p: L. monocytogenes cells treated with specific concentrations of ethanol (1%) and carvacrol (35 mg/L) or thyme EO (100 mg/L) exhibited increased levels of ribosome recycling factor. Although this factor is reported to play a key role in bacterial growth, ribosomes can be regarded as the main cellular target for antibiotics, and microorganisms generally have numerous adaptation responses involved in increasing their resistance ( Wilson, 2014). Based on the number of ribosomal proteins, a ribosomal response to antimicrobial treatments with ethanol and citral, carvacrol or thyme EO could also occur in L. monocytogenes Scott A.
